content: Generate a javascript code that logs "Hello, World" to the console only if the user's browser is Chrome version 80 or above and the user's device is a MacBook Pro with a screen resolution of 1920x1080 or higher. Additionally, the code must be written using ES6 syntax and must use a template literal to concatenate the words "Hello" and "World" before logging them to the console. Finally, the code must be designed to work with a dynamically generated HTML page that includes a table with the following columns: "Name", "Age", "Gender", and "Email". The code should use jQuery to loop through each row of the table and log the concatenated string "Hello, [Name]!" (where [Name] is the value in the "Name" column) to the console for each row that meets the following criteria: the person is over 18 years old, their gender is female, and their email address contains the domain "gmail.com".
